snippet: After Mohaman G. Koti got into a parking ticket dispute and shot a police officer, he was sentenced to 25 years to life for attempted murder. He has since become known as a peacemaker in prison, but has been turned down for parole six times.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column focuses on Mohaman G Koti, Manhattan man who shot a police officer more than 35 years ago over a parking ticket dispute and was sentenced to 25 years to life for attempted murder; notes Koti, who is now officially 85 years old, has since become a  peacemaker in prison but has been turned down for parole six times.
lead_paragraph: After Mohaman G. Koti got into a parking ticket dispute and shot a police officer, he was sentenced to 25 years to life for attempted murder. He has since become known as a peacemaker in prison, but has been turned down for parole six times.

headline.main: He’s Over 80, but a Convict Gets No Parole
headline.print_headline: He’s Over 80, But a Convict Gets No Parole
